ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Demonstrates how to use multiple Band-Series to simulate a Fan Chart
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates how to use multiple [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#The%20Band%20Series%20Type.html']FastBandRenderableSeries[/url] to simulate a Fan Chart.
The [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#The%20Band%20Series%20Type.html']FastBandRenderableSeries[/url] requires an [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Model.DataSeries.XyyDataSeries%602.html']XyyDataSeries[/url], which has X,Y0,Y1 points, to display a solid band between high and low Y-value.
In this example, we overlay several Band-Series with varying opacity to simulate a Fan-chart.
[b]Documentation Links[/b]
- [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#The%20Band%20Series%20Type.html']FastBandRenderableSeries Type[/url] - [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Model.DataSeries.XyyDataSeries%602.html']XyyDataSeries Type[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/Common%20RenderableSeries%20Properties.html']RenderableSeries API[/url]
